unnormalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews in Real Estate & Property**
normalised: **Quora Post: Builder Reviews in Real Estate and Property**

unnormalised: Hey everyone, planning to buy a flat in Bangalore and super stressed about choosing the right builder! I've heard horror stories about delayed possessions and shoddy construction, especially with new projects popping up like mushrooms after the monsoon.
normalised: Hey everyone, planning to buy a flat in Bangalore and super stressed about choosing the right builder! I have heard horror stories about delayed possessions and shoddy construction, especially with new projects popping up like mushrooms after the monsoon.

unnormalised: So, what's everyone's experience with finding reliable builder reviews in India? Are there specific sites or communities people recommend? I've tried a few aggregators, but the reviews often seem vague or even planted (you know, that overly enthusiastic "best builder EVER!" type).
normalised: So, what is everyone's experience with finding reliable builder reviews in India? Are there specific sites or communities people recommend? I have tried a few aggregators, but the reviews often seem vague or even planted (you know, that overly enthusiastic "best builder ever!" type).

unnormalised: I'm particularly interested in feedback on builders around Sarjapur Road. Been eyeing a project there, but want to do my due diligence. Heard mixed things about Prestige and Sobha, any firsthand experiences?
normalised: I am particularly interested in feedback on builders around Sarjapur Road. Been eyeing a project there, but want to do my due diligence. Heard mixed things about Prestige and Sobha, any firsthand experiences?

unnormalised: Also, what red flags should I be looking out for when reading builder reviews? Besides the obviously fake ones, are there specific issues (e.g., poor post-sales service, hidden charges) that consistently pop up? Ideally, I'd love to hear experiences related to projects delivered around 2018-2020 since that gives a good indication of long-term quality.
normalised: Also, what red flags should I be looking out for when reading builder reviews? Besides the obviously fake ones, are there specific issues (for example, poor post-sales service, hidden charges) that consistently pop up? Ideally, I would love to hear experiences related to projects delivered around two thousand eighteen to two thousand twenty since that gives a good indication of long-term quality.

unnormalised: Any advice would be a lifesaver! I have a site visit scheduled on 10/11/2024 at 11:00 hrs and want to go in prepared. Budget is around Rs. 80 lakh, hoping to find something decent within 5 km of my current office near Electronic City.
normalised: Any advice would be a lifesaver! I have a site visit scheduled on tenth november two thousand and twenty four at eleven zero zero hours and want to go in prepared. Budget is around rupee eighty lakh, hoping to find something decent within five kilometer of my current office near Electronic City.

unnormalised: Thanks in advance for your insights! And if you've had a particularly good or bad experience with a builder, please share the name! Even negative reviews can be immensely helpful (as long as they're genuine, of course!). Jai Hind! My friend Rahul had a bad experience with possessions on 01/01/2021, don't want the same for me.
normalised: Thanks in advance for your insights! And if you have had a particularly good or bad experience with a builder, please share the name! Even negative reviews can be immensely helpful (as long as they are genuine, of course!). Jai Hind! My friend Rahul had a bad experience with possessions on first january two thousand and twenty one, don't want the same for me.
